menuBar.name: Menu bar
menuBar.description: Changes visibility settings of native menu bar.

labels.hide: Hide menu bar automatically (<kbd>ALT</kbd> key switches the visibility).

tray.name: Tray
tray.description: Changes the visibility of the icon in the system tray.

labels.disable: Disable hiding window to the system tray functionality.

custombar.name: Non-native window bar
custombar.description: Removes native window borders and adds to it a HTML-based title bar, like it is done in official Discord client. To access WebCord's settings, press on the title on the title bar. Currently non-native title bar lacks of menu bar.

labels.use: Display non-native window bar (requires application restart).

taskbar.name: Taskbar
taskbar.description: Controls the behavior of taskbar entry of WebCord.

labels.flash: Flash taskbar button on new messages.

window.name: WebCord's main window
window.description: Controls the look and behavior of the window displaying client interface.

labels.hideOnClose: Hide window to tray with the close button.

blockApi.name: Discord API blocking
blockApi.description: Blocks Discord API requests for hardening the privacy.

permissions.name: Permissions
permissions.description: Allows or denies the permission checks and request from the Discord website. Please note that other permissions not listed here are blocked automatically by WebCord.

csp.name: Content Security Policy
csp.description: Switches whenever application should ignore Discord's Content Security Policy headers and let client set its own CSP for privacy and security concerns.

cspThirdParty.name: Third party websites
cspThirdParty.description: Sets a list of the third-party websites allowed to connect or display content.

currentInstance.name: Discord instance
currentInstance.description: Selects the instance WebCord should connect to. Experimental as the Fosscord implementation is not fully finished yet.

devel.name: Developer mode
devel.description: Enables the access to tools and unfinished options that are potentially considered as broken or dangerous. Disclaimer: application maintainers are not responsible for any bugs or issues after this option is enabled – please do not report them!

redirection.name: Cross-origin redirection behavior
redirection.description: Controls the actions on cross-origin redirections. This affects application security.

labels.warn: Always warn user about cross-origin redirections to external applications.

optimize.name: Client optimizations
optimize.description: Tries to detect the user software and hardware to apply custom flags to the Chromium engine that might improve Electron's performance or functionality. Experimental, as there's a reason why Chromium does not apply these flags by default.

labels.gpu: Optimize the client for the currently active graphics card.

webApi.name: Access to JavaScript APIs
webApi.description: Controls which API should be permitted in unpriviledged (DOM) scripts.

unix.name: Experimental features for Unix/Unix-like OS
unix.description: Enables features that were flagged by Chromium/Blink engine as experimental. Use them at your own responsibility.
